intro: Calymmodon grantii, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight. Calymmodon grantii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
